question_content.description:
### Problem02

Suppose that you load the following program into locations 10-20 of TOY:

```
10: 7101
11: 7A30
12: 7B08
13: 130B
14: C320
15: 1400
16: 2543
17: C51E
18: 16A4
19: A706
1A: 1717
1B: B706
1C: 1414
1D: C016
1E: 6331
1F: C014
20: 0000
```

Now suppose that you load 1 2 3 4 4 3 2 1 into memory locations 30 through 37, sec the PC to 10, and press RUN. What will be the contents of memory locations 30 through 37 when the program halts?

Answer: _____(0)\___, _____(1)\___, _____(2)\___, _____(3)\___, _____(4)\___, _____(5)\___, 3, _____(6)\___ (from mem[30] to mem[37]). Note: Please write the decimal numbers.

*Excerpt From Computer Science Sedgewick, Robert,Wayne, Kevin. This material may be protected by copyright.*
question_content.author: Beilong Tang
